about_the_game:
Though this game carries the name of its predecessor, it doesn't have much in common with it and is a completely new game.

Note: This is not a trading game! Instead, it is about obtaining items for sale through your own collection, planting, and other functions.

It will not support the Steam Workshop as I do not have the capability to do so.

The development team still consists of only me, and I cannot meet high expectations. You can try the free version before purchasing, and if the gameplay suits you, then buy it.

Each game I develop is the best I can do at the current stage, and I have invested a lot in this one.

Gameplay

It's very different from the challenging games I've developed in the past where bankruptcy leads to failure. This game is a pure collection-based casual simulation management game. There is no bankruptcy or time limit, so you can play it in a relaxed manner.

Of course, it lacks challenge and may bore players who enjoy challenges, as it cannot suit all players.

The game does not have a “completion” concept, it is considered 'completed' when you no longer wish to play.

Resources can be obtained through farmland, cooking, or wild collection, and can be directly sold to shops or used to complete residents' commissions to earn money.

The prices of items will change once a week.

Although decision-making will affect the speed of making money, there is no need to be nervous, after all, there is no time limit, it's just a difference in speed.

Even if all the money is wasted, you can start over by working in the town's restaurant, so you don't have to worry about being in a dead end.

Controls

Most operations are completed by clicking with the mouse (keyboard is used for collecting in the wild). It is also a turn-based game, and time will not pass without operation, so you can play it at ease.

Unlike ordinary farm games, there is no character to operate, but a conceptualized interface game.

Art

All art is hand-drawn. The more complex pieces are outsourced to artists for a fee, and many more artistic resources will be added in the future.

music

The background music is carefully selected high-quality paid licensed music.

Other

There is no investment, and I have always been developing games by myself at home.
